values.description: The Relative Vigor Index (RVI) compares the ratio of the closing price of a security to its trading range. For illustration, let: <para>a = Close−Open</para><para>b = Close−Open of One Bar Prior to a</para><para>c = Close−Open of One Bar Prior to b</para><para>d = Close−Open of One Bar Prior to c</para><para>e = High−Low of Bar a</para><para>f = High−Low of Bar b</para><para>g = High−Low of Bar c</para><para>h = High−Low of Bar d</para> Then let (a+2*(b+c)+d)/6 be NUM and (e+2*(f+g)+h)/6 be DENOM. <para>RVI = SMA(NUM)/SMA(DENOM)</para> for a specified period. https://www.investopedia.com/terms/r/relative_vigor_index.asp
values.og:description: The Relative Vigor Index (RVI) compares the ratio of the closing price of a security to its trading range. For illustration, let: <para>a = Close−Open</para><para>b = Close−Open of One Bar Prior to a</para><para>c = Close−Open of One Bar Prior to b</para><para>d = Close−Open of One Bar Prior to c</para><para>e = High−Low of Bar a</para><para>f = High−Low of Bar b</para><para>g = High−Low of Bar c</para><para>h = High−Low of Bar d</para> Then let (a+2*(b+c)+d)/6 be NUM and (e+2*(f+g)+h)/6 be DENOM. <para>RVI = SMA(NUM)/SMA(DENOM)</para> for a specified period. https://www.investopedia.com/terms/r/relative_vigor_index.asp
